main event: A civilian observed a large orange object moving silently overhead in Petersburg, Virginia on June 12, 1966.
interesting points: The object was approximately 75 feet in size with a white light around the edges, and had no visible airplane-like wings or tail.
As the object moved to the southeast, it began to fade from view and looked like a star becoming smaller in the distance.
The entire sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds.
The observer described the object as being larger in size but not as brilliant as a full moon, and its reddish-orange color changed intensely.
The object did not appear to follow the curvature of the horizon and simply disappeared in the distance.
sighted object: large orange object with white lights around the edges
